text: <@U7SL518D6> <@UATE4ATHP> Thank you so much for the help.

Hi everyone!
We have come across an *undocumented* requirement in the Theme validation process in HubSpot Marketplace, which seems to be either a misunderstanding or a bug. While this requirement may be suitable for *standalone modules* in the Marketplace, it is not ideal for *Themes*. Specifically, this requirement restricts custom modules in a Theme from having the *same `label`* (not *`name`*) as the default modules.

Further details and reasons explaining why this requirement may not be advisable can be found in our <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Improvements-to-HubSpot-Asset-Marketplace-Theme-requirements/idc-p/819367#M148694|post in HubSpot Ideas portal>. However, we are uncertain if this portal is the appropriate channel to receive a response. Therefore, we are reaching out here as well, in hopes that someone can assist us or connect us with the appropriate contact.
Thank you in advance for any help provided.
Are HubSpot modules back in the marketplace now?
